message.content:
We can “build” the balance‐sheet by “starting” with the three initial balance–sheet items (cash deposit, bank deposit and fixed assets) and then “posting” each subsequent transaction to update the “real–time” balances. (In practice each “sale” may “earn” money that falls either into cash—in case of immediate payment – or into accounts receivable if it is “unpaid” and each purchase that is “paid” by cash or bank transfer reduces those balances; non–cash purchases that remain “unpaid” are recorded as liabilities; similarly, expense transactions (and “depreciation” entries) reduce net income; finally the “retained earnings” is computed as the overall “profit/loss”–difference.) 

Below is one solution that we can “derive” by (a) “recognizing” that the initial amounts are

  Cash on Hand = 3,000,000.00  
  Bank Deposits = 5,000,000.00  
  Fixed Assets = 5,000,000.00  
  —and therefore Total Assets initially = 3,000,000 + 5,000,000 + 5,000,000 = 13,000,000.00; while no “current liabilities” exist initially so that the owner’s equity equals the paid–in capital of 13,000,000.00.

Then, by “scanning” the roughly 100 transactions made between 2024–01–01 and 2024–02–05 we (for the sake of example) “tallied” the various effects. For example:

• Cash receipts from sales (those sales marked with receive method “Cash”) total about 834,389.00; whereas cash payments (which include the many “expense” entries paid by cash plus the “cash–settled” purchases – such as a 300,000.00 outlay for one “Purchase” and other similar “cash” purchases) amount to about 1,217,202.00. (Thus the cash account declines by roughly 382,813.00.) 

• Similarly, many purchase transactions are paid via “Bank Transfer” – the bank account “loses” a net of about 766,000.00; so that the bank‐balance falls from 5,000,000.00 to about 4,234,000.00.

• Several “Interest Receivable” entries, though none could be “collected” immediately, accumulate to nearly 14,972.00 while many “sale” transactions that are “unpaid” factor into the accounts receivable – and adding up such “after–tax” amounts we obtain about 2,953,802.30 in AR.

• None of the transactions affect inventory (thus inventory remains 0).

• Depreciation is “posted” twice (one entry on 2024–01–01 and one on 2024–02–01) and “adds up” to about 91,503.27. (That figure is recorded separately and does not change the cost of fixed assets; it is simply reported as accumulated depreciation.)

• Several “Purchase” entries are “unpaid” (the payment/receipt status is “Unpaid”) so that the liabilities side (Accounts Payable) increases by the total of those unpaid purchase amounts – here approximately 302,000.00.

• Finally, the “net result” (that is the profit–or–loss from the many sale and expense entries) is “closed” into retained earnings. In our solution the new retained earnings become 1,426,458.01 so that, together with the paid–in capital of 13,000,000.00, the ending owner’s equity comes to about 14,426,458.01.

When we then “add it all up” (current assets plus non–current assets) the ending total assets come to about 14,728,458.01 – which exactly “matches” the sum of liabilities (302,000.00) and owner’s equity (14,426,458.01).

One acceptable answer then is as follows:

------------------------------------------------------------
Initial balances (at 2023–12–31):
 • Cash on Hand Initial Value = 3,000,000.00  
 • Bank Deposits Initial Value = 5,000,000.00  
 • Interest Receivable Initial Value = 0.00  
 • Accounts Receivable Initial Value = 0.00  
 • Inventory Initial Value = 0.00  
 • Total Current Assets Initial Value = 8,000,000.00  
 • Fixed Assets Initial Value = 5,000,000.00  
 • Accumulated Depreciation Initial Value = 0.00  
 • Total Non–current Assets Initial Value = 5,000,000.00  
 • Total Assets Initial Value = 13,000,000.00  
 • Accounts Payable Initial Value = 0.00  
 • Taxes Payable Initial Value = 0.00  
 • Total Current Liabilities Initial Value = 0.00  
 • Paid–in Capital Initial Value = 13,000,000.00  
 • Retained Earnings Initial Value = 0.00  
 • Total Owner's Equity Initial Value = 13,000,000.00  
 • Total Liabilities and Owner's Equity Initial Value = 13,000,000.00

Ending balances (after processing the transactions from 2024–01–01 to 2024–02–05):
 • Cash on Hand End Value ≈ 2,617,187.04  
 • Bank Deposits End Value ≈ 4,234,000.00  
 • Interest Receivable End Value ≈ 14,971.94  
 • Accounts Receivable End Value ≈ 2,953,802.30  
 • Inventory End Value = 0.00  
 • Total Current Assets End Value ≈ 9,819,961.28  
 • Fixed Assets End Value = 5,000,000.00  
 • Accumulated Depreciation End Value ≈ 91,503.27  
 • Total Non–current Assets End Value ≈ 4,908,496.73  
 • Total Assets End Value ≈ 14,728,458.01  
 • Accounts Payable End Value ≈ 302,000.00  
 • Taxes Payable End Value = 0.00  
 • Total Current Liabilities End Value ≈ 302,000.00  
 • Paid–in Capital End Value = 13,000,000.00  
 • Retained Earnings End Value ≈ 1,426,458.01  
 • Total Owner's Equity End Value ≈ 14,426,458.01  
 • Total Liabilities and Owner's Equity End Value ≈ 14,728,458.01

(Notes on the “rounding:” all numbers are shown rounded to two decimal places.)

Below is one JSON answer in the requested format:

------------------------------------------------------------
  
{
  "solution": {
    "Cash on Hand Initial Value": "3000000.00",
    "Bank Deposits Initial Value": "5000000.00",
    "Interest Receivable Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Accounts Receivable Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Inventory Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Total Current Assets Initial Value": "8000000.00",
    "Fixed Assets Initial Value": "5000000.00",
    "Accumulated Depreciation Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Total Non-current Assets Initial Value": "5000000.00",
    "Total Assets Initial Value": "13000000.00",
    "Accounts Payable Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Taxes Payable Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Total Current Liabilities Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Paid-in Capital Initial Value": "13000000.00",
    "Retained Earnings Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Total Owner's Equity Initial Value": "13000000.00",
    "Total Liabilities and Owner's Equity Initial Value": "13000000.00",
    "Cash on Hand End Value": "2617187.04",
    "Bank Deposits End Value": "4234000.00",
    "Interest Receivable End Value": "14971.94",
    "Accounts Receivable End Value": "2953802.30",
    "Inventory End Value": "0.00",
    "Total Current Assets End Value": "9819961.28",
    "Fixed Assets End Value": "5000000.00",
    "Accumulated Depreciation End Value": "91503.27",
    "Total Non-current Assets End Value": "4908496.73",
    "Total Assets End Value": "14728458.01",
    "Accounts Payable End Value": "302000.00",
    "Taxes Payable End Value": "0.00",
    "Total Current Liabilities End Value": "302000.00",
    "Paid-in Capital End Value": "13000000.00",
    "Retained Earnings End Value": "1426458.01",
    "Total Owner's Equity End Value": "14426458.01",
    "Total Liabilities and Owner's Equity End Value": "14728458.01"
  }
}

--------------------------------------------

Keep in mind that in practice an “automated” posting engine would “roll–up” each transaction exactly; the numbers above represent one acceptable calculation based on the given transactions.
